snippet.textDisplay:
This was a surprisingly well done film!

Very cliche, many logic gaps, and two bad hard edit points, but so, so much fun to watch! James Marsden does a great job as the everyman, Jim Carrey just evil enough to be a bad guy, not scary enough to be too much for a kids film.

I think there are SEVERAL sequels in the future!
snippet.textOriginal:
This was a surprisingly well done film!  

Very cliche, many logic gaps, and two bad hard edit points, but so, so much fun to watch!  James Marsden does a great job as the everyman, Jim Carrey just evil enough to be a bad guy, not scary enough to be too much for a kids film.

I think there are SEVERAL sequels in the future!

Parents never bought me a Metroid game when I was a kid and it just never interested me enough to buy them as I got older. Can't relate.

Deus ex needs a series. Please.

snippet.textDisplay: To everyone saying “It’s just a kids movie” I just have to ask, is Star Wars a kids movie? Should we not criticize Episode 9? Oh, no you’re saying while Episode 9 is meant for children it’s also made for adults, especially those who grew up with the franchise..... that’s sounds a lot like Sonic now doesn’t it? Is Sonic not a kids movie? You see this is all so dumb, where do we draw the line? you can make a good kids movie, you can make a bad kids movie, and if you have to say “it’s just a kids movie” to defend a movie then you’re really only trying to justify why it’s bad rather say why it’s good. It’s a product, you can criticize it.
snippet.textOriginal: To everyone saying “It’s just a kids movie” I just have to ask, is Star Wars a kids movie? Should we not criticize Episode 9? Oh, no you’re saying while Episode 9 is meant for children it’s also made for adults, especially those who grew up with the franchise..... that’s sounds a lot like Sonic now doesn’t it? Is Sonic not a kids movie? You see this is all so dumb, where do we draw the line? you can make a good kids movie, you can make a bad kids movie, and if you have to say “it’s just a kids movie” to defend a movie then you’re really only trying to justify why it’s bad rather say why it’s good. It’s a product, you can criticize it.

snippet.textDisplay: The worst thing about getting older is how we over-analyze everything, we find logic and meaning in things and in the process destroy the wonder we used to see as kids. This movie made me feel like a kid again and that's not always a bad thing. It is not a great movie, but it served its purpose as a movie in that it was made to entertain me, and it did.
snippet.textOriginal: The worst thing about getting older is how we over-analyze everything, we find logic and meaning in things and in the process destroy the wonder we used to see as kids. This movie made me feel like a kid again and that's not always a bad thing. It is not a great movie, but it served its purpose as a movie in that it was made to entertain me, and it did.

"Does character design make a movie? Absolutely not."

snippet.textDisplay: I’d like to say that every yawn in the movie became worth it after seeing Jim Carrey’s final scene!  Holy that was hilarious, surreal, video game, Bradbury, Carreyesque! snippet.textDisplay:
The video game movies I'd like to see, if they were done right other than Metal gear solid and Metroid are.

Snatcher- Scifi
Night trap- Horror
Dishonored- Action fantasy
L.A. noir- crime drama
Infamous and or prototype- Super Hero
Red Dead redemption- Western
Wolfenstein- Action shooter
Uncharted- Action-adventure & comedy
Maniac Mansion day of the tentacle- animated comedy.
Saints Row- Gang Action Drama
Adam wake- psychological horror
Mist- idk I never played it.

One reviewer said there was there different acts of perversion in the movie. I only got the two wives, and beeing envolved with a dead woman. Regardless, nothing was tamed down. Another reviewer said, "So what, if it scaries a child. I loved being frighten as childen." Most of my friends hate Tim Burtan, but I've never seen a product placement is his personal movies. snippet.textDisplay: Just seen the movie earlier today. It was done really well I thought. Watching this movie took me back to the days of the Sega Genesis console, and the kids who were probably seeing this Sonic character for their first time were loving it! Spoiler post-credit scene. It was great to see Jim Carrey again, and even the supporting cast like Natasha Rothwell did a great job playing their roles.

snippet.textDisplay:
Regarding the whole "domestic terrorist" part of the film that's seemingly dropped - I think that this may be intentional: it highlights how anyone can be declared a "terrorist" for any reason whatsoever and most people aren't even aware of it - the reason why no one reacts to a "terrorist" walking among them is because no one really cares because the state has already declared so many people to be "terrorists" on the most flimsy of pretexts. Furthermore, the reason why no one other than Robotnik (a government contractor that has exceeding his mandate - much like "Blackwater" [or whatever else they call themselves these days...]) is hunting them is because the purpose of the "intelligence community" is to create false flags and mislead people into backing foreign wars of imperialistic aggression: they tend to leave hunting the "terrorists" to loose cannons that cause a lot of destruction in their wake because, in the end, capturing the "terrorists" isn't the end goal anyway - the goal is to create an illusion of a threat to justify conquest.


I know that the film never comes out and says any of this but one can read this implication into the events of the film - I think that it's a very subtle, yet very cutting, satire of the "war on terror" that the writers managed to sneak into a kids film without being preachy: I believe that they knew that only the most perceptive and politically-aware would catch get the message.
snippet.textOriginal:
Regarding the whole "domestic terrorist" part of the film that's seemingly dropped - I think that this may be intentional: it highlights how anyone can be declared a "terrorist" for any reason whatsoever and most people aren't even aware of it - the reason why no one reacts to a "terrorist" walking among them is because no one really cares because the state has already declared so many people to be "terrorists" on the most flimsy of pretexts.  Furthermore, the reason why no one other than Robotnik (a government contractor that has exceeding his mandate - much like "Blackwater" [or whatever else they call themselves these days...]) is hunting them is because the purpose of the "intelligence community" is to create false flags and mislead people into backing foreign wars of imperialistic aggression: they tend to leave hunting the "terrorists" to loose cannons that cause a lot of destruction in their wake because, in the end, capturing the "terrorists" isn't the end goal anyway - the goal is to create an illusion of a threat to justify conquest.


I know that the film never comes out and *says* any of this but one can read this implication into the events of the film - I think that it's a very subtle, yet very cutting, satire of the "war on terror" that the writers managed to sneak into a kids film without being preachy: I believe that they knew that only the most perceptive and politically-aware would catch get the message.

snippet.textDisplay: This movie could've had better action. It was so lacking in that department. Though it was an ok film, I expected so much crazier battles from Sonic and Dr. Robotnik. Hell, honestly, the movie should've gone full blown Chaos Arc from Sonic Adventure -- Sonic and his team vs Robonik vs Chaos! (Also, the plot wasn't that good. Sonic never got challenged as he was so powerful).
snippet.textOriginal: This movie could've had better action. It was so lacking in that department. Though it was an ok film, I expected so much crazier battles from Sonic and Dr. Robotnik. Hell, honestly, the movie should've gone full blown Chaos Arc from Sonic Adventure -- Sonic and his team vs Robonik vs Chaos! (Also, the plot wasn't that good. Sonic never got challenged as he was so powerful).

snippet.textDisplay:
Awww. I think I disagreed with almost every detailed point in this review! I never played the game and thought it was cute (and went to see it). I adored Marsden and barely tolerated Carey.

I’m good with the final score, and totally set my expectations in accordance with a video game movie so forgave a lot of the silly story beats. We just got there by entirely different paths!

Just wish we hadn’t eaten at the movie so we could’ve gone after to get Olive-ized. 😊
snippet.textOriginal:
Awww. I think I disagreed with almost every detailed point in this review! I never played the game and thought it was cute (and went to see it). I adored Marsden and barely tolerated Carey. 

I’m good with the final score, and totally set my expectations in accordance with a video game movie so forgave a lot of the silly story beats. We just got there by entirely different paths!

Just wish we hadn’t eaten at the movie so we could’ve gone after to get Olive-ized. 😊
